## Pre-Workshop Requirements

### Software Installation

Before attending the workshop, please complete the software installation following our [Module 0 Installation Guide](module-0/installation.qmd).

**Essential Software:**
- R (≥4.3.0) and RStudio
- Python (≥3.8) with Miniconda/Anaconda
- Command-line tools via Bioconda
- Specialized phylogenetics software

### Hardware Requirements

- **Laptop:** Administrative privileges required for software installation
- **RAM:** Minimum 8GB, 16GB recommended  
- **Storage:** At least 20GB free space for data and software
- **OS:** Windows 10+, macOS 10.15+, or Linux (Ubuntu 18.04+)

## Datasets

### Primary Workshop Datasets

All datasets will be provided during the workshop via:

1. **Local servers** - Fast access during hands-on sessions
2. **Cloud storage** - Download links for persistent access
3. **USB drives** - Backup distribution method

**Dataset Overview:**

:::{.dataset-card}
**SARS-CoV-2 Global Surveillance Data**
- 500 complete genomes from different lineages
- Temporal sampling: 2020-2025  
- Geographic diversity: 6 continents
- Use cases: Phylogenetics, molecular clock, selection
:::

:::{.dataset-card}
**Influenza H3N2 Evolution**
- 10 years of seasonal influenza sequences
- HA and NA gene segments
- Antigenic site annotations
- Use cases: Selection analysis, drug resistance
:::

:::{.dataset-card}
**HIV-1 Drug Resistance**
- Clinical isolates with resistance profiles
- Pol gene sequences with phenotype data
- Longitudinal patient samples
- Use cases: Resistance evolution, population structure
:::

:::{.dataset-card}
**Hepatitis B Outbreak Investigation**
- Simulated outbreak scenario
- 150 linked cases with metadata
- Epidemiological data included
- Use cases: Outbreak analysis, transmission inference
:::

## Software Tools & Packages

### Core Bioinformatics Tools

**Quality Control & Assembly**
- [FastQC](https://www.bioinformatics.babraham.ac.uk/projects/fastqc/) - Sequence quality assessment
- [Trimmomatic](http://www.usadellab.org/cms/?page=trimmomatic) - Read trimming and filtering
- [SPAdes](https://cab.spbu.ru/software/spades/) - Genome assembly
- [Minimap2](https://github.com/lh3/minimap2) - Sequence alignment

**Phylogenetic Analysis**
- [MAFFT](https://mafft.cbrc.jp/alignment/software/) - Multiple sequence alignment
- [IQ-TREE](http://www.iqtree.org/) - Maximum likelihood phylogenetic inference
- [BEAST2](https://www.beast2.org/) - Bayesian phylogenetics and molecular dating
- [FigTree](http://tree.bio.ed.ac.uk/software/figtree/) - Tree visualization

### R Packages

**Core Packages**
```r
# Phylogenetics and evolution
ape, phytools, ggtree, treeio

# Population genetics  
adegenet, poppr, hierfstat

# Sequence analysis
Biostrings, seqinr, muscle

# Data manipulation and visualization
tidyverse, ggplot2, plotly
```

**Installation Commands**
```r
# CRAN packages
install.packages(c("ape", "phytools", "adegenet", "tidyverse"))

# Bioconductor packages
BiocManager::install(c("ggtree", "Biostrings", "muscle"))
```

### Python Libraries

**Essential Libraries**
```python
# Core scientific computing
numpy, pandas, scipy, matplotlib, seaborn

# Bioinformatics
biopython, scikit-bio, dendropy

# Phylogenetics
ete3, toytree, phylopandas
```
